modules.description: Provides functions to define and manage command-line interfaces using a declarative approach, including methods to configure, extend, and execute commands. Works with custom data types representing configurations, options, and command structures. Enables creation of CLI tools with typed arguments and structured subcommands, such as parsing and validating user input for a custom build system.

This module provides utilities for manipulating and extracting metadata from OCaml abstract syntax tree (AST) nodes, focusing on attributes like documentation, defaults, and environment variables. It operates on parsetree elements, Ppxlib, and Migrate_parsetree types to generate documentation, converters, and expansion code for ppx rewriters. Specific use cases include enhancing type and label declarations with runtime annotations or automating code generation tasks.
